titleStmt.title: M. R. Tarter to Thomas e. Bramlette
CWG7025

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos. E. Bramblette Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky

Your Petitioner M. R, Tarter would respectfully represent that at July Term 1865 ^of the Pulaski Circuit Court^ he was fined $30 for an assault -- He states that he did not Know that there has to be any court in July and the case was tried in his absence. The only Testimony for the Commonwealth was Dickerson Thompson the prosecutor -- He states that had he Known the trial would be had in July he would have been able to have shown himself not guilty -- He says he did not assault or molest the Prosecutor any way and he was fined for an offense of which he was innocent -- He prays that sd fine be remitted --
We concur in the prayer of the above Petition and recommend the remission of the fine --

Rob Gibson
F, F, Shepherd
S
W Woodcock
Jas Chesney
W. McKee Fox
W D Carpenter
E L Van Winkle
Thos. Z Morrow
James Singdon Sheff
J W Hail
John Griffen
Silas Lee
J,, B. Dalton stats that he was one of guard,, that guarded Dickerson Thompson & that M,, R, Tarter drew no weapon upon the said Dickerson as he saw or believes
Sworn to before me by J. B Dalton Sept 25th 1865

Pulaski Cir Ct
vs
M R. Tarter
$30,
Remitted 23d Oct 1865

Waterloo P. O.
Pulaski Co
Ky
